did.abstract: A 1675 petition disavowing the radical Quaker preacher Thomas Case of Newtown, Queens, signed by prominent Quakers in several Long Island meetings.

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies
altformavail.p: Due to the fragility of the original document, the first folder of this two-folder collection contains a surrogate copy and typed transcription for research use.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The original item is housed in its own folder and the surrogate copy and transcription for research use are foldered separately.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: Due to the extremely fragile nature of the original document, users may only consult the provided surrogate copy and transcription.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Prominent Quakers in several Long Island meetings joined in this petition to disavow any relationship with Thomas Case and his followers. Case was a radical Quaker preacher from Newtown, Queens County who proclaimed himself a second Christ. As a group, signers of this petition joined together to go on record as opposing and denying Case's blasphemy. Signers of the petition originated from areas of Long Island such as Gravesend, Flushing, Matinecock, and Newtown. The petition is dated 1675.
